content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/api-ai-java-webhook is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
I need to migrate a Java project from JDK 8 to JDK 17. Let me start by exploring the project structure to understand what I'm working with.

Steps:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to see the current Java version and dependencies
3. Update the pom.xml to Java 17 and update dependencies
4. Run `mvn clean verify` to see if there are any issues
5. Fix any compilation or test issues
6. Continue until `mvn clean verify` passes

Let's start by viewing the project structure.

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>org.springframework</groupId>
    <artifactId>api-ai-java-webhook</artifactId>
    <version>0.1.0</version>

    <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>1.3.3.RELEASE</version>
    </parent>

    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-actuator</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>


    <properties>
        <java.version>1.8</java.version>
    </properties>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
            </plugin>

            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-dependency-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.4</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>copy-dependencies</id>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals><goal>copy-dependencies</goal></goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>

</project>

    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>org.springframework</groupId>
    <artifactId>api-ai-java-webhook</artifactId>
    <version>0.1.0</version>

    <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>

        <version>3.2.2</version>
    </parent>

    <dependencies>

        </dependency>
        <dependency>

        </dependency>
        <dependency>

    <properties>

        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    </properties>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
            </plugin>

            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-dependency-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.6.1</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>copy-dependencies</id>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals><goal>copy-dependencies</goal></goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>

</project>

The test is failing because the info endpoint is returning 404. In Spring Boot 3, the actuator info endpoint needs to be explicitly exposed. Let me check if there's an application.properties file and update it:
/tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/api-ai-java-webhook/src/main/resources/application.properties

File content displayed in console.
Content: server.port: 9000
management.port: 9001
management.address: 127.0.0.1
Now I need to update the application.properties to expose the info endpoint in Spring Boot 3 format:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_restricted_shell_20260128/api-ai-java-webhook/src/main/resources/application.properties
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string: server.port: 9000
management.port: 9001
management.address: 127.0.0.1
New string: server.port=9000
management.server.port=9001
management.server.address=127.0.0.1
management.endpoints.web.exposure.include=info,health
management.info.env.enabled=true

Excellent! The Java 17 migration is complete and successful. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## Migration Completed Successfully ✅

The project has been successfully migrated from Java 8 to Java 17, and `mvn clean verify` now passes.

### Key Changes Made:

1. **pom.xml Updates:**
   - Updated Spring Boot from 1.3.3.RELEASE to 3.2.2 (latest stable version with Java 17 support)
   - Changed Java version from 1.8 to 17
   - Updated maven-dependency-plugin from 2.4 to 3.6.1

2. **Test Class Migration:**
   - Migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 (Jupiter)
   - Updated test annotations from Spring Boot 1.x style to Spring Boot 3.x:
     - `@RunWith(SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class)` → removed (not needed in JUnit 5)
     - `@SpringApplicationConfiguration` → `@SpringBootTest`
     - `@IntegrationTest` → `@SpringBootTest(webEnvironment = WebEnvironment.RANDOM_PORT)`
     - `@Value` annotations → `@LocalServerPort` and `@LocalManagementPort`
   - Changed from creating new TestRestTemplate instances to injecting via `@Autowired`
   - Updated actuator endpoint path from `/info` to `/actuator/info`

3. **Application Configuration:**
   - Updated application.properties to Spring Boot 3.x syntax
   - Enabled actuator endpoints (info, health) for proper testing
   - Updated management server configuration

All dependencies are now compatible with Java 17, and the build passes successfully with all tests passing.
